page.title: 19FLORA OF THE ARUN GAP
page.content: The countryside around the Arun River comprising so many different types of land cover presents us with a great variation in its flora. The grassy slopes of the Downs are thick with wild thyme, hare- bells, scabious, birdsfoot trefoil and wild straw- berries in season. In the lanes and fields are poppies, moon daisies, buttercups, cornflowers, chamomile, canterbury bells, yarrow, dandelions, clovers and the various umbelliferous plants of which the cow parsley is the most common. Hedges bear crops of blackberries, sloes, crab apples, rose-hips and haws, old man's beard and wild vines. The woods have their seasons for violets, primroses, anemo- nes and bluebells, while the wetlands and meadows contain reeds, rushes, kingcups, yellow irises, water crows- foot, water mint, and meadowsweet.
